page.title: 09HOUSING AROUND GRAFTON
page.content: In this area there are a number of old cottages. Some are built of stone with slate roofs and others of wattle and daub, with thached roofs.This area is well known for thached roofs.Many of the older cottages were demolished and rebuilt by the Lord of the Manor in 1855. Each village has had modern houses built which generally blend in with the older houses.In Temple Grafton there are two rows of council houses.One row is cement_rendered and the other row is red brick.There are also several terraced houses in Temple Grafton.You had to go up the garden to the toilet because they used not to have indoor toilets. Welford has much more modern property and many of the older houses have been enlarged. The council houses are semi-detached but most of the houses here are detached.
